title: Deputies: 9-year-old shot in Barrow County
content:
Please install the latest Adobe Flash Player Plugin to watch this content.
BARROW COUNTY, Ga. - Barrow County deputies are investigating a shooting involving a 9-year-old girl.
Deputies were called to the scene at Highway 82 and Giles Road Monday afternoon.
Deputies said the shooting appeared accidental and that no charges have been filed yet.
They said the girl's mother's boyfriend told them he accidentally shot the girl while he was cleaning his gun. A bullet struck the girl in her side.
Deputies are questioning him and the mother, along with two other children who were in the house at the time.
Channel 2’s Darryn Moore reports deputies escorted a man from the mobile home.
“Right now we are looking at primarily to see if the evidence we found on the scene matches the witness testimonials of those who were here,” said Matthew Guthas, with the Barrow County Sheriff’s Office.
The roadway was blocked for a short time so a medical helicopter could land.
Neighbors didn't hear the shot but saw the commotion.
“Didn't see anything until I saw the police roll up,” said neighbor Brad Partin.
The girl's mother and two other children were also home but were not injured.
